titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact proceedings
Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact proceedings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-02T11:32-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Description of Box 2 contents added by Sarah Patton.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Abstract and genre terms updated, information about reformatted AV materials added.

did.unittitle: Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact proceedings
did.abstract: Sound recordings and video tape of proceedings, transcripts of conference papers, photographs of conference participants, and printed matter relating to Radio Liberty and Radio Free Europe broadcasting to the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe. Conference sponsored by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace and the Cold War International History Project of the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars. Use copies of sound and video recordings available.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact (2004 : Hoover Institution)

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of all sound and video recordings in this collection are available for immediate access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact proceedings, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2005.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings and video tape of proceedings, transcripts of conference papers, photographs of conference participants, and printed matter relating to Radio Liberty and Radio Free Europe broadcasting to the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe. Conference sponsored by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace and the Cold War International History Project of the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars. Use copies of sound and video recordings available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a word processing file, Elena Bonner.doc, authored by Natasha Porfirenko. The file contains a Russian transliteration of the speech Bonner gave at the conference. For printout of speech text, see Box 2, Folder 6.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a word processing file, CONF.doc, authored by Paul B. Henze. The file contains a memo from Henze to Elena Danielson, "Radio Impact Conference; Topics not Covered." For printout of memo, see Box 2, Folder 10.

did.unittitle: Videorecording of Václav Havel video address to the conference,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A leading dissident during the Communist era, Václav Havel's writings reached his fellow citizens through the broadcasts of the RFE Czechoslovak Service. Invited to address the Conference on Cold War Broadcasting Impact at the Hoover Institution in 2004, Havel was unable to attend but recorded for conference participants his thoughts on the significance of RFE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: CDs (two of which are duplicates of others) contain .jpg image files of the conference and participants. For print versions of a subset of these photos, see Photographs (Box 2, Folder 14).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes draft conference papers by Gregory Mitrovich, Paul B. Henze, Alan L. Heil Jr., George Woodard, R. Eugene Parta, E. I. Bashkirova, Lechoslaw Galikowski, Pawel Machcewicz, Jane Curry, and Oldřich Tůma.

did.unittitle: "A Preliminary Empirical Assessment of the Roles of Radio Liberty and Western Broadcasting to the USSR During the Cold War: A Study Based on Audience Research Findings, 1970-1991," R. Eugene Parta,
"Listening Rates to Western Radio Stations in Poland, Hungary, Czechoslovakia, Romania and Bulgaria, 1962-1988: Longitudinal Listening Trend Charts," compiled by R. Eugene Parta,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printout from a word processing file on a floppy disk. Due to the document being created in an earlier version of Word, there are some extraneous symbols present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes draft conference papers by Nestor Ratesh, Germina Nagat, Jordan Baev, István Rév, János Berecz, Amier Weiner, Peter Zvagulis, and Wladimir Tolz.

did.unittitle: "Radio Free Europe/Radio Free Liberty Documents, 1953-1986," document reader,
Memorandum from Paul B. Henze to Elena Danielson, "Radio Impact Conference; Topics not Covered,"
Cold War Broadcasting Impact: Conference Summary,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes the following sections: I. Preface, II. Cold War Broadcasting Impact: Conference Summary, III. Cold War International Broadcasting: Lessons Learned, IV. Conference Participants.

did.unittitle: Voices of Hope: The Story of Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty exhibit postcards,
"Cardinal Miloslav Vlk, Archbishop of Prague on the Role of Radio Free Europe," translated by Olga Kopecka, condensed and edited by Ross Johnson, photocopy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Excerpts of speech delivered at a Czech Christian Academy symposium in Prague, October 13, 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 100 color prints (includes some duplicates) of conference participants. Includes photos of Suzanne Ament, Elena Bashkirova, Elena Bonner, James Brown, Robert Conquest, Richard Cummings, Jane Curry, Elena Danielson, Thomas Dine, John Dunlop, Charles Gati, Leszek Gawlikowski, Alan Heil, Paul Henze, David Holloway, A. Ross Johnson, Kenneth Jowitt, Gail Lapidus, Pawel Machcewicz, Gregory Mitrovich, Norman Naimark, Christian Ostermann, Eugene Parta, Mark Pomar, István Rev, Svetlana Savranskaya, Anatol Shmelev, George Shultz, Eugeniusz Smolar, Gene Sosin, Oldrich Tuma, Amir Weiner, Sharon Wolchik, George Woodard, and others.
